info.title: PhoneNumberLookup
info.description: Aprovide carrier information for a telephone number or batch of telephone numbers. Currently supports lookups of telephone numbers in the mainland United States, Alaska, Hawaii, District of Columbia, and the provinces of Canada. Telephone numbers submitted must be in E.164 format to be processed. ## Base Path https://numbers.bandwidth.com/api/v1

OrderResponse.title: OrderResponse
OrderResponse.description: The request has been accepted for processing but not yet finished and in a terminal state (COMPLETE, PARTIAL_COMPLETE, or FAILED)

status.description: The status of the request (IN_PROGRESS, COMPLETE, PARTIAL_COMPLETE, or FAILED).

failedTelephoneNumbers.description: The telephone numbers whose lookup failed

result.description: The carrier information results for the specified telephone number.

Message.description: Message associated with the response code.

E.164 Format.description: The telephone number in E.164 format.

Formatted.description: The formatted version of the telephone number.

Country.description: The country of the telephone number.

Line Type.description: The line type of the telephone number.

Line Provider.description: The service provider of the telephone number.

Mobile Country Code.description: The first half of the Home Network Identity (HNI).

Mobile Network Code.description: The second half of the HNI.

OrderStatus.description: If requestId exists, the result for that request is returned. See the Examples for details on the various responses that you can receive.  Generally, if you see a Response Code of 0 in a result for a TN, information will be available for it.  Any other Response Code will indicate no information was available for the TN.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the Bandwidth account that the user belongs to.

202.description: The request has been accepted for processing but not yet finished and in a terminal state (COMPLETE, PARTIAL_COMPLETE, or FAILED)

400.description: Bad Request. Ensure that your request payload is properly formatted and that the telephone numbers used are valid.

example.message: The following numbers are not supported. Only US (United States) and CA (Canada) number lookups are supported at this time: +1200207163, 12002077164, 12002077165

message.description: A description of what validation error occurred.

401.description: Unauthorized. Ensure that you are using the proper credentials for the environment you are accessing, your user has the proper role assigned to it, and that your Bandwidth account is enabled for TN Lookup access.

415.description: Invalid content-type. Ensure that your content-type header is set to application/json.

429.description: Too Many Requests. Reduce the amount of requests that you are sending in order to avoid receiving this status code.

5XX.description: Unexpected error. Please contact Bandwidth Support if your requests are receiving this status code for an extended period of time.

x-codeSamples.source:
<?php

require "vendor/autoload.php";

api-username = "api-username";
api-password = "api-pasword";
12345 = "12345";

$config = new BandwidthLib\Configuration(
    array(
        'messagingBasicAuthUserName' => $BW_USERNAME,
        'messagingBasicAuthPassword' => $BW_PASSWORD,
    )
);
$client = new BandwidthLib\BandwidthClient($config);

$phoneNumberLookupClient = $client->getPhoneNumberLookup()->getClient();

$body = new BandwidthLib\PhoneNumberLookup\Models\OrderRequest();
$body->tns = array("+15554443333");

try {
    $response = $phoneNumberLookupClient->createLookupRequest($BW_ACCOUNT_ID, $body);
    print_r($response->getResult()->requestId);
} catch (BandwidthLib\APIException $e) {
    print_r($e->getResponseCode());
}

from bandwidth.bandwidth_client import BandwidthClient
from bandwidth.exceptions.api_exception import APIException
from bandwidth.phonenumberlookup.models.order_request import OrderRequest

import os

BW_USERNAME = "api-username"
BW_PASSWORD = "api-password"
BW_ACCOUNT_ID = "12345"

bandwidth_client = BandwidthClient(
    phone_number_lookup_basic_auth_user_name=BW_USERNAME,
    phone_number_lookup_basic_auth_password=BW_PASSWORD
)
phone_number_lookup_client = bandwidth_client.phone_number_lookup_client.client

body = OrderRequest()
body.tns = ["+15554443333"]

try:
    response = phone_number_lookup_client.create_lookup_request(BW_ACCOUNT_ID, body)
    print(response.body.request_id)
except APIException as e:
    print(e.response_code)

require 'bandwidth'
  
include Bandwidth
include Bandwidth::Voice

BW_USERNAME = "api-username"
BW_PASSWORD = "api-password"
BW_ACCOUNT_ID = "12345"

bandwidth_client = Bandwidth::Client.new(
    phone_number_lookup_basic_auth_user_name: BW_USERNAME,
    phone_number_lookup_basic_auth_password: BW_PASSWORD
)

phone_number_lookup_client = bandwidth_client.phone_number_lookup_client.client

body = OrderRequest.new
body.tns = ["+15554443333"]

begin
    result = phone_number_lookup_client.create_lookup_request(BW_ACCOUNT_ID, body)
    puts result.data.request_id
rescue APIException => e
    puts e.response_code
end

get.description: Query an existing TN Lookup Order.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the Bandwidth account that the user belongs to.

200.description: If requestId exists, the result for that request is returned. See the Examples for details on the various responses that you can receive.  Generally, if you see a Response Code of 0 in a result for a TN, information will be available for it.  Any other Response Code will indicate no information was available for the TN.

400.description: Bad Request. Ensure that you have set the requestId as a URL path parameter.

401.description: Unauthorized. Ensure that you are using the proper credentials for the environment you are accessing, your user has the proper role assigned to it, and that your Bandwidth account is enabled for TN Lookup access.

404.description: RequestId not found. Ensure that the requestId used in the URL path is valid and maps to a previous request that was submitted.

429.description: Too Many Requests. Reduce the amount of requests that you are sending in order to avoid receiving this status code.

5XX.description: Unexpected error. Please contact Bandwidth Support if your requests are receiving this status code for an extended period of time.

x-codeSamples.source:
<?php

require "vendor/autoload.php";

api-username = "api-username";
api-password = "api-pasword";
12345 = "12345";

$config = new BandwidthLib\Configuration(
    array(
        'messagingBasicAuthUserName' => $BW_USERNAME,
        'messagingBasicAuthPassword' => $BW_PASSWORD,
    )
);
$client = new BandwidthLib\BandwidthClient($config);

$phoneNumberLookupClient = $client->getPhoneNumberLookup()->getClient();

$requestId = "1234-abcd";

try {
    $response = $phoneNumberLookupClient->getLookupRequestStatus($BW_ACCOUNT_ID, $requestId);
    print_r($response->getResult()->status);
} catch (BandwidthLib\APIException $e) {
    print_r($e->getResponseCode());
}

from bandwidth.bandwidth_client import BandwidthClient
from bandwidth.exceptions.api_exception import APIException

import os

BW_USERNAME = "api-username"
BW_PASSWORD = "api-password"
BW_ACCOUNT_ID = "12345"

bandwidth_client = BandwidthClient(
    phone_number_lookup_basic_auth_user_name=BW_USERNAME,
    phone_number_lookup_basic_auth_password=BW_PASSWORD
)
phone_number_lookup_client = bandwidth_client.phone_number_lookup_client.client

request_id = "1234-abcd"

try:
    response = phone_number_lookup_client.get_lookup_request_status(BW_ACCOUNT_ID, request_id)
    print(response.body.status)
except APIException as e:
    print(e.response_code)

require 'bandwidth'
  
include Bandwidth
include Bandwidth::Voice

BW_USERNAME = "api-username"
BW_PASSWORD = "api-password"
BW_ACCOUNT_ID = "12345"

bandwidth_client = Bandwidth::Client.new(
    phone_number_lookup_basic_auth_user_name: BW_USERNAME,
    phone_number_lookup_basic_auth_password: BW_PASSWORD
)

phone_number_lookup_client = bandwidth_client.phone_number_lookup_client.client

request_id = "1234-abcd"

begin
    result = phone_number_lookup_client.get_lookup_request_status(BW_ACCOUNT_ID, request_id)
    puts result.data.status
rescue APIException => e
    puts e.response_code
end
